Member Function Documentation
ApplySnapshot() ApplySnapshotPhoton.Pun.Simple.SyncState Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncStateApplySnapshot
override void Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncState.ApplySnapshot (Frame snapframe, Frame targframe, bool snapIsValid, bool targIsValid)[protected]
Notifying the SyncTransform of any parent changes, since they are managed here. Less than ideal, but the alternative is to completely move parent handing to SyncTransform. If the frame being passed is the snapFrame (we aren't doing some kind of rewind), notify the transform sync of upcoming parent changes

ChangeState() ChangeStatePhoton.Pun.Simple.SyncState Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncStateChangeState
virtual void Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncState.ChangeState (StateChangeInfo stateChangeInfo)[protected], [virtual]
Call this method to change the state of this object.
This state will be synced over the network, and callbacks will trigger locally and remotely. Typically it is preferred to call QueueStateChange(), which will defer the ChangeState application until the appropriate timing.
Assuming first Visible after a despawn is a Respawn - this is here to handle lost teleport packets
Test nothing has changed
Handling for attached without a valid Mount - Test for if we have a reference to a Mount, but it is null (Unity destroyed). Sets to hard null and reruns this method.
The State is mounted
Attaching to a mount
Detaching from a mount
Send out callbacks

ImmediateUnmount() ImmediateUnmountPhoton.Pun.Simple.SyncState Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncStateImmediateUnmount
void Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncState.ImmediateUnmount ( )
Handler that unparents this object from any mount immediately (rather than on the next tick Capture).
Put in place for handling despawning of objects, so that mounts on NetObjects can unmount all objects before self-destructing.

Be sure to use base.OnAwake() when overriding.

virtual void Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncState.OnNetObjReadyChange (bool ready)[virtual]
Respond to NetObject changes in Ready here.
